intro: Ozoroa pallida, commonly known as the white-flowered ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ozoroa pallida is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
